sen.j: 正親町三条公氏（さんじょう きんうじ、寿永元年（1182年）- 嘉禎3年9月15日 (旧暦)（1237年10月5日））は、鎌倉時代の公卿。
sen.e: Kinuji OGIMACHISANJO (1182 - October 5, 1237) was a Kugyo (court noble) in Kamakura period.

sen.j: 藤原北家閑院流の三条実房の三男で、正親町三条家の祖。
sen.e: He was the third son of Sanefusa SANJO who was from Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and the founder of the Ogimachisanjo family.

sen.j: 三条の他、嵯峨および西郊とも称す。
sen.e: Apart from Sanjo, he also called himself Saga and Saiko.

sen.j: 兄に三条公房、姉小路公宣がいる。
sen.e: Kinfusa SANJO was his older brother and Kiminobu ANEGAKOJI was his older sister.

sen.j: 1211年（建暦元年）参議に任じられ、その後正二位、大納言に累進している。
sen.e: In 1211, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor), later successively promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and Dainagon (a chief councilor of state).

sen.j: なお、明治維新後に正親町三条家は本家の三条家（転法輪三条家）と区別するために家名を「嵯峨」と改称した。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, Ogimachisanjo family changed their family name to 'Saga' to distinguish with Sanjo Family, which was the head family.
